alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 12:13PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Garfield and south central Wayne Counties through 100 PM MDT... At 1212 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Capitol Reef National Park, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Capitol Reef National Park, Fruita and Caineville. This includes the following highways... Utah Route 12 near mile marker 116. Utah Route 24 between mile markers 79 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; Southern Mountains; Western Canyonlands
